suppress.notes: file name: org.rdkit.knime.wizards_*.jar The RDKit Wizard will not be installed in KNIME, but in an IDE for development. It requires an Eclipse IDE and extends it, therefore we have to tolerate the IDE itself.

file name: org.rdkit.knime.nodes_*.jar: opsin-core-*-jar-with-dependencies.jar (shaded: org.apache.logging.log4j:log4j-api:2.17.2) The vulnerability targets only an Amazon Hotfix, not the log4j version per se. We are not using the Amazon Hotfix in context of RDKit nodes in KNIME.

file name: org.rdkit.knime.nodes_*.jar: opsin-core-*-jar-with-dependencies.jar (shaded: commons-io:commons-io:2.11.0) The vulnerability is categorized as MEDIUM, and OPSIN has per Dec 08, 2022 not provided a fix yet.

file name: org.rdkit.knime.nodes_*.jar: opsin-core-*-jar-with-dependencies.jar (shaded: commons-io:commons-io:2.11.0) The vulnerability is categorized as MEDIUM, and OPSIN has per Dec 08, 2022 not provided a fix yet.

file name: org.rdkit.knime.nodes_*.jar: opsin-core-*-jar-with-dependencies.jar (shaded: org.codehaus.woodstox:stax2-api:4.2.1) False positive. 4.2.1 is the latest version and free of known vulnerabilities as of March 07, 2023.

file name: org.rdkit.knime.nodes_*.jar: opsin-core-*-SNAPSHOT-2023-06-27-jar-with-dependencies.jar (shaded: com.sun.xml.bind.jaxb:isorelax:20090621) There is currently no fix provided by OPSIN, which has net.java.dev as a dependency that brings in isorelax in its only version. There is no newer version available.
